Posts.Content: Oct 17, 2014 03:44AM Kalonis52 wrote: Hi honey, Your so very young. I am not a Physician, but, it sounds like you may have "Calcium Deposits" which is a Cyst maybe developing. Or, this could be a hormonal thing. See your Physician on this. Good Luck! Kaloni
Posts.Title: fibroadenoma pain long after fibroadenoma removal surgery. Mcg321 Kalonis52

Posts.Content: Oct 17, 2014 11:37AM - edited Oct 17, 2014 11:44AM by Kalonis52 Hi honey, Yes, it could be scar tissue. Yes, Cysts. I have what is called an Oil Cyst. I have them in my right breast. They tend to come in clusters. Normally, they are benign. Non-cancerous. Or you may have a Fibroadenoma there. Alot of younger women get these hard lumps. Yes, get your US first and go from there. You will be fine. Good Luck! Kaloni

Posts.Content: Mar 22, 2014 07:58AM Kalonis52 wrote: Hi honey, First of all, sorry for your diagnosis. My lifestyle really did not change any. I still eat the junk food and drink some. There is so much miss advice on this subject. I just made a decision to go on a diet and try to eat properly, instead of Taco Bell. Ha. Plus, maybe lesson my drinking to 1 beer a week. I hope some of this helps you in making a right decision. Good luck! Kaloni

Posts.Title: help. nobody is responding to my posts. englishteacher juneth

Posts.Content: Oct 19, 2018 11:18PM Kalonis52 wrote: Hi Samnjb, We all welcome you here. So, sorry for your new diagnosis. Do you have a family history of Breast Cancer? I do. I was 40 when I was diagnosed with IDC in my left breast. I had only my left breast removed. I did not have a double Mastectomy. Its been 12 years now, and, the Cancer has never come back into my right breast. But, I do have a number of Oil Cysts in there. They are benign. Non-Cancerous. I think looking back now, I would of had a Double done. Its all overwhelming at first, but, you just take your time on making a decision. Keep us updated honey. Good Luck and Blessings!  Kaloni
